arm_group.description:
Patients in this arm have a hysterectomy via a single-port peri-umbilical laparoscopic surgical technique.
Intervention:  Single-port, peri-umbilical hysterectomy

Patients in this arm have a hysterectomy via a conventional multi-port  laparoscopic surgical technique.
Intervention: Multi-port hysterectomy

brief_summary.textblock:
The main objective of the study is the comparison of the effective duration of
      hospitalization following laparoscopic hysterectomy via a single-port peri-umbilical
      technique versus an conventional multi-port technique.

clinical_study.brief_title: Laparoscopic Hysterectomy Via a Single Port, Peri-umbilical Technique Versus a Conventional Laparoscopic Technique

detailed_description.textblock:
The secondary objectives are to compare the following between the two arms of the study:

        1. the difference between the real discharge date and the theoretical discharge date

        2. measures related to intraoperative bleeding

        3. operating time

        4. postoperative pain

        5. quality of life

        6. abdominal wall complication rates

        7. rates of further surgery and rehospitalization

        8. use of material resources in the operating room

        9. average costs of hospital stay

       10. Costs of rehospitalization at 1 year

       11. Indirect costs

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  The patient must have given her informed and signed consent

          -  The patient must be insured or beneficiary of a health insurance plan

          -  The patient is available for 12 months of follow-up

          -  The patient is declared fit by the anesthetist for an intervention by laparoscopy

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  The patient is not available for 12 months of follow-up

          -  The patient is participating in another study or is in an exclusion period determined
             by a previous study

          -  The patient is under judicial protection, under tutorship or curatorship

          -  The patient is not insured or beneficiary of a health insurance plan

          -  The patient refuses to sign the consent

          -  It is impossible to correctly inform the patient

          -  The patient cannot read French

          -  Patient with a history of pelvic radiotherapy

          -  Patient with a history of pelvic surgery or serious risk of major adhesions

          -  The patient is pregnant

          -  Contraindications for anesthesia for either surgical technique

          -  Promontofixation or lymphadenectomy

          -  No associated procedure other than morcellation or vaginal suture for extracting the
             hysterectomy specimen, unilateral or bilateral oophorectomy

          -  The patient has a known or suspected allergy to polyurethane

          -  Extended hysterectomy for neoplastic disease

intervention.description: Patients in this arm have a hysterectomy via a single-port peri-umbilical laparoscopic surgical technique.
Patients in this arm have a hysterectomy via a conventional multi-port laparoscopic surgical technique.

facility.name: CHU de Nîmes - Hôpital Universitaire Carémeau

clinical_study.official_title: Laparoscopic Hysterectomy Via a Single Port, Peri-umbilical Technique Versus a Conventional Laparoscopic Technique : a Prospective, Randomized, Multicenter Study Evaluating the Length of Hospital Stay

authority: France: Committee for the Protection of Personnes
France: Agence Nationale de Sécurité du Médicament et des produits de santé

primary_outcome.measure: Length of hospital stay in hours

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description:
Criteria for theoretical hospital discharge:
Visual analog scale for pain < 2 under stage 1 antalgics
No nausea, no vomiting
Resumption of transit, liquid and solid food
Capable of getting up, moving and going to the bathroom alone
Apyrexia
secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in hours between real discharge time and theoretical discharge time
Bleeding/fluid loss: Difference between lavage fluids and aspiration fluids
Surgical time, from first incision to closing

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 times per day during hospitalisation (expected maximum of 3 to 5 days)

secondary_outcome.description: Includes: hematomas around trocar sites; localized care for trocar infection or hematoma; surgery for trocar site herniation
Includes: hematomas around trocar sites; localized care for trocar infection or hematoma; surgery for trocar site herniation
Includes: hematomas around trocar sites; localized care for trocar infection or hematoma; surgery for trocar site herniation

secondary_outcome.measure: Presence/absence of complications according to Clavien scale
Presence/absence of complications according to Clavien scale
Inventory of reusable material in the operating room and related costs.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
